Subject: Re: How to identify a JavaCore failure ?

Hi Joby,

> 1) I guess your answer is there is no way to exclude
> any testcase from a Testsuite. I also want all my
> testcases to be pass. But due to some reasons I want
> to run only some of the testcases from a testsuites.
> 
> How I can do that ?
Currently, you can "not add", but you can't remove.  Refer to JB's post
for nice instructions to "not add".

> 2) JavaCore is an enhanced debug facility for the Java
> platform. It enables "core" dumping when an un-handled
> Exception is thrown.Is there any way to handle this as
> fail in JUnit ? 
Just checked it out.  (Needs recompiling for 1.4 up.)  So long as your
application is not catching the thrown Exception, you can catch it in
your test and fail() it.  (I am interpreting your questions as how to
handle as a fail, and not an error.)

try {
    thingToTest.doYourStuff();
} catch (RuntimeException thrown) {
    fail(thrown.getMessage());
}

Best regards,
-- Shinobu Kawai

--
Shinobu Kawai <shinobu@..., shinobu@...>
